title: Corruption Case Regarding Agricultural Grant for High-Tech Nursery in Kalikot
description:
The Commission for the Investigation of Abuse of Authority (CIAA) filed a corruption case at the Special Court in Kathmandu against 12 individuals and one cooperative society concerning the misuse of a government grant. The case revolves around an agricultural subsidy of NPR 6,650,000 provided by the Karnali Province Government during the 2078/79 fiscal year to Simnath Krishi Vikas Sahakari Sanstha Ltd. in Kalikot for the establishment of a high-tech fruit nursery.

The core allegations state that the defendants colluded to embezzle the grant money without completing the project as per the agreement. The CIAA's investigation claimed that Bharat Bahadur Basnet, then-acting chief of the Agriculture Knowledge Center, along with engineer Sumit Bhatt and sub-engineer Gururaj Sanjyal, prepared a fraudulent feasibility report. This report allegedly recommended the project for a location that lacked the necessary electricity supply for a high-tech nursery. Furthermore, they were accused of preparing an inflated cost estimate and purchasing equipment at excessively high prices.

The prosecution claimed that these officials, in collusion with the evaluation committee and cooperative members, produced a false work completion report without proper on-site verification, leading to the wrongful disbursement of the grant. The CIAA charged that the evaluation committee members acted with bad faith by approving the flawed evaluation report and forwarding it to the provincial Ministry of Land Management, Agriculture, and Cooperatives. The cooperative's chairman and treasurer were accused of creating a false proposal, despite lacking the institutional financial capacity, and accepting the grant money without actually establishing the nursery.

On December 18, 2023, the Special Court, under a bench led by Chairperson Tek Narayan Kunwar with judges Ram Bahadur Thapa and Muraribabu Shrestha, acquitted all accused parties, citing a lack of sufficient evidence to prove the corruption charges. Dissatisfied with this verdict, the CIAA has since filed an appeal at the Supreme Court, moving the case to the next judicial level.
unverified_info:
The initial source document provided for this case contained the following details that could not be independently verified by public news reports or official press releases:

  • The name Chandra Bhushan Jha as a main accused. All official reports and news articles list Bharat Bahadur Basnet as the primary government official charged.
  • The involvement of employees from Humla and Mugu district offices. The case documents and reports specifically focus on the Agriculture Knowledge Center in Kalikot and the provincial ministry in Surkhet.
key_allegations: Embezzlement of NPR 6,650,000 in government grant funds.
Preparation of a fraudulent and technically unviable feasibility study for a high-tech nursery.
Creation of an inflated cost estimate for the project and equipment.
Issuance of a false work completion report without proper site inspection to facilitate payment.
Collusion between government officials, an evaluation committee, and cooperative members to misuse public funds.

timeline.title: CIAA Files Corruption Case
timeline.description: The CIAA filed a corruption case at the Special Court in Kathmandu against 12 individuals and one cooperative, alleging misuse of NPR 6,650,000 from an agricultural grant.

timeline.title: Special Court Acquits All Defendants
timeline.description: The Special Court acquitted all 13 defendants, including Bharat Bahadur Basnet and the cooperative, citing insufficient evidence to prove the charges.

timeline.title: CIAA Appeals to Supreme Court
timeline.description: The CIAA issued a press release (dated 2081/05/09 BS) confirming it had filed an appeal at the Supreme Court against the Special Court's acquittal verdict.
